title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people protested Trump's immigration policy at Boston Common amid 15-degree weather.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was organized by Mass 50501 and other local groups.
The demonstration is part of a national series of protests following the 'National Shutdown.'

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox may trade for an infielder before spring training, focusing on defensive rather than power-hitting options.
ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests potential targets could be Isaac Paredes from Houston or other infielders.
Boston Globe reports Red Sox are weighing internal options like Marcelo Mayer for third base role this season.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, advanced to Super Bowl LX after a 14-3 season.
Drake Maye's father, Mark Maye, expressed surprise at the Patriots' unexpected Super Bowl run following previous poor seasons.
Patriots' postseason performance has been challenged by Maye's reduced efficiency, with just 55.8% pass completion in playoffs.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth and Mike Tirico will call Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks for NBC.
Collinsworth has covered five previous Super Bowls involving the Patriots, including their last game against the Seahawks.
The Patriots have been a focal point in Collinsworth's broadcasts this season with NBC covering three significant games.

title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Auburn snowplow driver Matte McGarry rescued an older man trapped in a snowbank during a storm.
The man was walking home after a Patriots game and fell headfirst into a 3-foot deep snowbank.
McGarry will receive a commendation from the Auburn Board of Selectmen for his life-saving actions.

title: UMass student suspended after organizing protest sues university
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: UMass Amherst suspended student Kivlighan de Montebello for organizing a protest against defense contractor RTX during a career fair.
De Montebello filed a lawsuit claiming the suspension violates his First Amendment right to free speech, seeking damages and expungement.
UMass claims it supports free speech, but can impose restrictions to maintain campus operations and accessibility.

title: More details emerge about children charged with murder in R.I.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Four preteens charged with murder in Providence after allegedly beating 51-year-old Rony Alonso on January 19.
Police arrested the children following a rock-throwing incident on January 20, linking them to Alonso's fatal beating.
Charges escalated to murder after Alonso died on January 22; suspects were arraigned in Family Court.

title: Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Curtis, a 16-year-old Highland steer at Allandale Farm in Jamaica Plain, has died peacefully, following his brother's death last year.
Curtis and his brother Willard arrived at Allandale Farm in 2008 from Vermont and became beloved local figures.
The public can share memories of Curtis on the farm's website; details on a celebration of life will be announced later.

title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox are reportedly considering trading reliever Jordan Hicks to acquire an infielder before spring training begins.
Starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval are also being discussed in trade talks with interest in Boston's pitching depth.
Infielders linked to Red Sox include Nico Hoerner, Matt Shaw, Isaac Paredes, and free agent Eugenio Suarez.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots linebacker K’Lavon Chaisson had a career year with 7.5 sacks, 18 QB hits, and 10 tackles for loss.
Chaisson expressed a strong desire to re-sign with the New England Patriots during upcoming free agency.
Chaisson praised Patriots' coordinators for their roles in leading the team to the Super Bowl this season.
